title: Jaco Peyper under investigation by World Rugby after Sebastien Vahaamahina elbow picture
text:
Jaco Peyper was snapped imitating the Sebastien Vahaamahina elbow (Picture: Twitter/ArnaudCoudry)

Jaco Peyper will be subject to a World Rugby investigation after being pictured reenacting Sebastien Vahaamahina’s now-infamous elbow, for which the referee sent him off.

France were leading Wales 19-10 in their Rugby World Cup quarter-final clash early in the second half when Vahaamahina struck flanker Aaron Wainwright in the face with his elbow.

Referee Peyper initially only awarded a penalty but after seeing the incident on the TV screen in the stadium, called for a TMO review and immediately decided to show Vahaamahina a red card.

France failed to score another point and a late try from Ross Moriarty ensured Wales progressed through to the semi-finals with a narrow 20-19 victory.

Vahaamahina was sent off by Peyper after 49 minutes of the quarter-final (Picture: Getty)

There was little argument from the dismissed second row or his team-mates at the time but controversy stirred when a photo emerged of Peyper posing with Wales fans after the game.

The South African referee, who could still take charge of the final if his native South Africa do not make it through, was pictured with seven Wales fans and joined in with them in mimicking the flailing left elbow that had earned Vahaamahina his tournament-ending red card.

A statement from the Rugby World Cup organising body said: ‘World Rugby is aware of a picture on social media of referee Jaco Peyper with a group of Wales fans taken after last night’s [Sunday] quarter-final between Wales and France in Oita.

‘It would be inappropriate to comment further while we are establishing the facts.’

Neither the France coach Jacques Brunel or the captain Guilhem Guirado disagreed with the decision afterwards and Wainwright, the man caught by the blow, agreeing that it was an unpleasant act – one pundit and former Wales international Gareth Thomas calling it a shameful ‘act of violence’.

Wainwright said: ‘It was a maul, and he had me by the neck to start with.

‘I was trying to get the referee’s attention, and then the elbow came in.

Wainwright copped one in the face from Vahaamahina (Picture: ITV)

‘I was a bit surprised the referee didn’t see it to start off with, but thankfully the television match official pulled it up and it was dealt with.

‘We put the pressure on afterwards and saw the game through.

‘I am fine at the moment. It wasn’t that nice at the time.’
description: Jaco Peyper will be subject to a World Rugby investigation after being pictured reenacting Sebastien Vahaamahina's now-infamous elbow, for which the referee sent him off.
